item.title: Mentioned by Brantford Expositor
item.description:
Brant riding a priority for federal NDP: Dewar
The federal riding executive and its candidate of record Marc Laferriere haven't let themselves go dark in between election campaigns- the group brought Ottawa Centre NDP MP Paul Dewar to the riding Wednesday for more than a handful of meetings with ...

item.title: Mentioned by MetroNews Canada
item.description:
New Democrat MP fined over robocalls
THE CANADIAN PRESS/Sean Kilpatrick. OTTAWA – A New Democrat member of Parliament has been fined by Canada's telecommunications regulator over robocalls made during the party's last leadership campaign. Paul Dewar was fined $7,000 by the ...

item.title: Mentioned by mysask.com
item.description:
NDP MP Paul Dewar fined $7000 by regulator over campaign robocalls
NDP MP Paul Dewar asks a question during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on April 26, 2013. Paul Dewar was fined $7,000 by the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission as part of what it ...

item.title: Mentioned by Calgary Herald
item.description:
Ottawa Centre MP Dewar to pay $7000 in fines over illegal robocalls
OTTAWA — The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission has handed out a total of $17,000 in fines over illegal robocalls made last year on behalf of the NDP and party leadership candidate Paul Dewar, the MP for Ottawa Centre.
